properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 3:51AM CST until February 5 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
...Light Wintry Precipitation Followed By Accumulating Snow...

.A light wintry mix of precipitation will spread from northwest to
southeast across the region this afternoon and tonight as a low
pressure system approaches from the southwest. Snow will then
develop from southwest to northeast across the area on Wednesday
and may be heavy at times along and north of the Interstate 44
corridor. A wintry mix will remain possible Wednesday across
south-central Missouri.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation
expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice
accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter
Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of
3 to 6 inches possible.

* WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas and central, southwest
and west central Missouri.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon today to 6
AM CST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday
morning through late Wednesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening and morning commutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

In Kansas, road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
